text:
The documentation of the <property> task tells how a property can be set from a file or 
resource. However, it does not say what a "resource" is, and I had a hard time figuring out 
what it might be. In several places the Ant documentation talks about "file or resource" but 
never defines the latter. 
 
I suggest to include a definition of "resource" in a prominent place in the documentation.
creator: klute@apache.org
stevel@apache.org
text:
fixed in CVS, with a revised property.xml.

You should note that 'resource' is a standard term in java programming, which is
why we never bothered to mention it. But if you are learning Ant at the same
time as Java, it may be new, hence the fix.

creator: klute@apache.org
text:
Hm, standard term? I don't think so. At least it is not a common term, except
perhaps in certain contexts. I am doing Java development for 7 years now so I
should know... :-)

creator: bodewig@apache.org
text: Hmm, Class.getResource() and friends have been there since Java 1.0.

creator: klute@apache.org
text:
I don't speak against that, and I just found out that the Javadoc of
Classloader.getResource() explains what a "resource" is. But I doubt that many
(even experienced) developers are delved into that depths.
